comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Raj,

Could you please re-test your application with this patch (attached to the issue) and let me know if that fixes the problem?

Oleg

comments.author: Raj
Raj
comments.body:
Hi Oleg, 
    It need not to be tunnelled always, right?
Regards,
Raj

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Raj,

Thanks for testing the patch. 

It is not quite clear why ISA decides to re-authenticate the user while keeping the same connection alive. Seems wrong and broken. Anyways, I'll commit the patch without the route#isTunnelled() check.

Oleg

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Updated patch checked in to the SVN trunk. Please re-test your application against the latest SVN snapshot

https://repository.apache.org/content/repositories/snapshots/org/apache/httpcomponents/httpclient/4.0-SNAPSHOT/

Oleg

comments.author: Raj
comments.body:
Hi Oleg,
              I have tested, it works,  Actually, I am using 3.1,  any plans of doing this for 3.1 or 
will it be fixed there or shall I have the fix here locally, what do you suggest?

thanks,
Raj

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Raj,

You are welcome to back-port the fix to the 3.x branch and I will happily commit it to the official SVN repository. However, it is very unlikely there will ever be an official release off the 3.x branch. HttpClient 3.x is pretty much end of life.

Oleg

comments.author: Dhil
Daniel Kugel
comments.body: I'm trying to back port the patch to httpclient 3.1 and I was wondering if I could simply add {code:java}method.getProxyAuthState().invalidate();{code} to the end of the method {code:java}private boolean processRedirectResponse(final HttpMethod method){code} in HttpMethodDirector.java?

description:
The issue has been discussed in, http://www.nabble.com/redirect-fails-when-NTLM-authentication-is-used-for-proxy-tt23867531.html This was found in http client 3.1 release, where NTLM proxy authentication is must and the server ask the redirect to a new url, in this case, when redirecting, the earlier proxy auth status is not cleared, so, it does not do proxy authentication for the new URL and hence fails. Target Host Authenticaiton NTLM authentication - redirect also had problem and fixed as said, http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HTTPCLIENT-211 Proxy Authentication - redirect has to be fixed, The wire logs for the release https://repository.apache.org/content/repositories/snapshots/org/apache/httpcomponents/httpclient/4.0-beta3-SNAPSHOT/ is given below, [DEBUG] wire - >> "GET http://verisign.com HTTP/1.1[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - >> "Host: verisign.com[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - >> "Proxy-Connection: Keep-Alive[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - >> "User-Agent: Apache-HttpClient/UNAVAILABLE (java 1.5)[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - >> "[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - << "HTTP/1.1 407 Proxy Authentication Required ( The ISA Server requires authorization to fulfill the request. Access to the Web Proxy filter is denied. )[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - << "Via: 1.1 lab1[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - << "Proxy-Authenticate: Negotiate[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - << "Proxy-Authenticate: Kerberos[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - << "Proxy-Authenticate: NTLM[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - << "Proxy-Authenticate: Basic realm="lab1."[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - << "Connection: Keep-Alive[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - << "Proxy-Connection: Keep-Alive[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - << "Pragma: no-cache[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - << "Cache-Control: no-cache[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - << "Content-Type: text/html[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - << "Content-Length: 4107 [EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - << "[EOL]" [DEBUG] wire - << "[\r][\n]" [DEBUG] wire - << "Error Message[\r][\n]" [DEBUG] wire - << "[\r][\n]" [DEBUG] wire - << "[\r][\n]" [DEBUG] wire - << "[\r][\n]" [DEBUG] wire - << "[\r][\n]" [DEBUG] wire - << "[\r][\n]" [DEBUG] wire - << " [\r][\n]" [DEBUG] wire - << " [\r][\n]" [DEBUG] wire - << " [\r][\n]" [DEBUG] wire - << " [\r][\n]" [DEBUG] wire - << " [\r][\n]" [DEBUG] wire - << " [\r][\n]" [DEBUG] wire - << "

summary: Proxy NTLM Authentication  Redirecting to different address fails saying Proxy Auth Required.
